header_contributing: Please take a quick look at the [contribution guidelines](.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) first. If you see a package or project here that is no longer maintained or is not a good fit, please submit a pull request to improve this file. Thank you to all [contributors](https://github.com/matteocrippa/awesome-swift/graphs/contributors); you rock!!

projects.description: ISO BMFF, DASH, CMAF and HbbTV - DVB segment validation conformance

projects.description: Dash proxy is a tool that allows for easy downloading or mirroring of remote MPEG-DASH streams.

projects.title: 17 Free MPEG-DASH example and HLS m3u8 sample test streams
projects.description: Collection of publicly available and free MPEG-DASH and HLS examples, test streams and datasets to help you through your development process

projects.title: HLS and Fragmented MP4 | HTTP Live Streaming
projects.description: At WWDC 2016, Apple announced support for fragmented MP4 (fMP4) as an alternative to MPEG-TS, which prior to their announcement was the only supported format.

projects.title: create-DASH-HLS
projects.description: A tutorial to generate fMp4 files compatible with dash and HLS

projects.title: demo-encoder
projects.description: A nodejs encoding system based on ffmpeg and configured to write HLS streaming files to S3

projects.title: HLSDownloader
projects.description: Downloads m3u8 playlist and TS chunks for a given playlist URL.

projects.description: Describes the requirements for live and VOD audio-video content delivery using HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) to Apple devices.

projects.title: ffmpeg audio/video manipulation
projects.description: How to tame the Swiss army knife of audio and video manipulation…

projects.title: Apple Got It Wrong: Encoding Specs for HEVC in HLS
projects.description: Though I didn't recognize it at first, when Apple released its encoding specifications for HEVC and HLS, they got it wrong, though it took a comment from a true encoding expert to help me realize it.

projects.title: CRF Guide (Constant Rate Factor in x264, x265 and libvpx)
projects.description: The Constant Rate Factor (CRF) is the default quality (and rate control) setting for the x264 and x265 encoders, and it’s also available for libvpx.
